comments.body: As discussed, there will be another PR changing these to v1.1

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +2,6 @@# This is a hack to import from a branch and call it a versioned snapshot.

VERSION=v1.0
OUTDIR=v1.0
REPORT_TAG=v1.0.1

comments.body: I guess, we need to update https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/blob/master/build/versionize-docs.sh#L56 as well, then
Thanks.  I'll fix that when I encounter it.
Ahh, in versionize we actually call `gsed` on macOS - is that a better fix?  The sed logic here and there really should be ~identical.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +30,34 @@for dir in docs examples; do
    find ${OUTDIR}/${dir} -type f -name \*.md | while read X; do
        sed -i .import_docs_tmp \
            -e '/<!-- BEGIN STRIP_FOR_RELEASE.*/,/<!-- END STRIP_FOR_RELEASE.*/d' \
            -e "s|releases.k8s.io/HEAD|releases.k8s.io/${REPORT_TAG}|g" \
